result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawnee M. Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawnee M. Chapman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawnee M. Chapman was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Shawnee M. Chapman was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from DOC requesting amendment to JOC

11:40 a.m. Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf288, 16cm47. 
In 16cf288 - Sowinski states agreement. State moves to dismiss Counts 2 and 3 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Sowinski/Richards/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 3 years - Consecutive to 14cf147
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees- Remitted
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. 
Appeal rights given. NADVI given. 


16cm47 - All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Sowinski/Richards/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Jail - 9 months each count - CC to  14CF147
No jail credit
Any financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.
Appeal rights given.

Adj. 12:05 p.m.

3:21 p.m. Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court, via video, in custody. Court notes revocation hearing in another matter. This matter to track with revocation. Adj. 3:22 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 11:30 am.
includes revocation summary and cover letters
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 11, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing Hearing on Revocation moved to 1/11/2017 to coincide with other open matter.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 20, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on January 9, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Notified Sara- $100 was posted at LDF - extension will  be given -
Per Judge Bloom - if $100 is posted the warrant may be quashed and extension given for remainder of fine.
per Sara @ ONSO - detainer - Vilas County
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
Notified Sarah at ONSO - voluntary appearance

2:19 p.m. Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant. Pfeifer statement to agreement. State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 4 - Granted. Plea quesionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Counts 2 and 3.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Pfeifer/Burns/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Restitution - $44.00 plus 10% surcharge of 4.40 for a total of $48.40
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 2:38 pm  Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:47 p.m. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Burns was expecting defendant to be in court. Burns statement that matter is resolved. Court authorizes warrant based on non-appearance. Adj. 3:48 p.m.
Pre-trial conference on June 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:04
Defendant now makes an appearance in court - Court quashes warrant (not yet done)  Burns statement to status - just recently appointed and defendant is hoping to obtain DL - request adj - no objection by State
Bail continued - Counsel to get new date from JA -

ADDRESS INFO for Shawnee M. Chapman
Current: P.O. Box 132, 2179 Wildcat Lane, Lac Du Flambeau, WI 54538   (Effective: 01-27-2016)
Prior: 2179 Wildcat Lane, Lac Du Flambeau, WI 54538

Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:32
Burns statement - unable to contact - number on bond is not correct - and number the PDs office has is disconnected - Court authorizes warrant
Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
No entry upon any Walgreens premises.

1:36 pm Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in court, via video, with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Shawnee M. Chapman in custody.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Schiek/Hogan statement to bond. Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 1:39 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
